skill.name: biorxiv-database
skill.description: Efficient database search tool for bioRxiv preprint server. Use this skill when searching for life sciences preprints by keywords, authors, date ranges, or categories, retrieving paper metadata, downloading PDFs, or conducting literature reviews.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate scientific tool for searching bioRxiv's public API and downloading preprints. All 252 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES: markdown code fences were flagged as shell commands, bioRxiv DOIs (10.1101/xxx) were flagged as IP addresses, and legitimate API URLs were flagged as hardcoded URLs. The tool performs standard HTTP requests to api.biorxiv.org and writes files to user-specified paths - all intentional behaviors for a research API client.

low_findings.title: User-controlled file writes
low_findings.description: The tool writes JSON results and PDFs to paths specified by the user. This is necessary functionality for a search/download tool.

low_findings.title: Network requests to external API
low_findings.description: HTTP requests to api.biorxiv.org for searching and downloading preprints. This is the intended and documented behavior.

content.value_statement: Finding life sciences preprints requires manually browsing bioRxiv or using multiple tools. This skill provides a unified Python interface to search by keywords, authors, categories, and date ranges, then download papers and metadata in structured JSON format.
actual_capabilities: Search preprints by keywords in title, abstract, or author fields
Find papers by author name within date ranges
Retrieve paper metadata including DOI, title, authors, and abstracts
Download full-text PDF files for offline analysis
Export results to structured JSON for downstream processing
limitations: Searches only bioRxiv, not other preprint servers like medRxiv
Keyword matching uses simple substring search, not semantic search
Author search relies on name string matching, not author IDs
Rate limited to one request per 0.5 seconds by design

use_cases.title: Literature review
use_cases.description: Search for recent preprints in your research area to stay current with emerging findings before journal publication.

use_cases.title: Track competitor research
use_cases.description: Monitor publications by specific authors or research groups to track field developments and potential collaborations.

use_cases.title: Build research datasets
use_cases.description: Collect paper metadata programmatically to build datasets for bibliometric analysis and text mining projects.

prompt_templates.title: Basic keyword search
prompt_templates.scenario: Find recent papers on a topic
prompt_templates.prompt: Search bioRxiv for preprints about {topic} from the last {months} months. Save results to {filename}.json.

prompt_templates.title: Author search
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all bioRxiv preprints by {author_name} from {start_date} to {end_date}. Download any PDFs.

prompt_templates.title: Category filter
prompt_templates.prompt: Search the {category} category for papers about {keywords} in the last {time_period}. Output to {filename}.json.

prompt_templates.title: Batch download
prompt_templates.prompt: Search bioRxiv for {keywords}, get the top 10 papers by date, and download their PDFs to the papers/ directory.

output_examples.input: Search bioRxiv for papers about CRISPR gene editing from the last 6 months
output: Found 42 preprints on CRISPR gene editing
Most recent: 'Novel CRISPR-based approach for enhanced genome editing efficiency'
Authors: Smith J, Johnson A, Williams K

output_examples.input: Find all preprints by Dr. Jane Smith from 2023
output: Found 15 preprints by Jane Smith in 2023
Topics include: neuroscience, machine learning, neural networks

output_examples.input: Search neuroscience category for papers about Alzheimer's
output: Found 28 papers from the last 90 days
Top cited: 'Early detection of Alzheimer's markers in brain scans'
License: CC BY for all results

best_practices: Use category filters to reduce data transfer and improve search speed
Save search results to JSON files for later analysis rather than repeating API calls
Include date ranges or use --days-back to limit result sets for faster queries
anti_patterns: Searching without date limits on broad keywords like 'cancer' will return thousands of results
Downloading many PDFs in quick succession without delays may trigger rate limits
Using author names without dates returns only papers from the past year by default

faq.question: Does this search medRxiv or other preprint servers?
faq.answer: No, this skill only searches bioRxiv which focuses on life sciences. Other servers require separate tools.

faq.question: How many results can I retrieve at once?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit but very large result sets may take time. Use --limit to cap results.

faq.question: Can I use this in automated pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, the Python API is designed for programmatic use. Export JSON for downstream analysis.

faq.question: Is my search data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: Only to bioRxiv's public API. No personal data is collected or stored externally.

faq.question: Why are my searches failing?
faq.answer: Check your date format is YYYY-MM-DD. Verify internet connectivity and API availability.

faq.question: How is this different from Google Scholar?
faq.answer: This tool accesses bioRxiv's API directly for structured metadata. Google Scholar covers published papers with different search semantics.
